statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
There are N cities, and M directed roads connecting them. Now you want to transport K units of goods from city 1 to city N. There are many robbers on the road, so you must be very careful. The more goods you carry, the more dangerous it is. To be more specific, for each road i, there is a coefficient ai. If you want to carry x units of goods along this road, you should pay ai * x2 dollars to hire guards to protect your goods. And what’s worse, for each road i, there is an upper bound Ci, which means that you cannot transport more than Ci units of goods along this road. Please note you can only carry integral unit of goods along each road.
You should find out the minimum cost to transport all the goods safely.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There are several test cases. The first line of each case contains three integers, N, M and K. (1 <= N <= 100, 1 <= M <= 5000, 0 <= K <= 100). Then M lines followed, each contains four integers (u<sub>i</sub>, v<sub>i</sub>, a<sub>i</sub>, C<sub>i</sub>), indicating there is a directed road from city u<sub>i</sub> to v<sub>i</sub>, whose coefficient is a<sub>i</sub> and upper bound is C<sub>i</sub>. (1 <= u<sub>i</sub>, v<sub>i</sub> <= N, 0 < a<sub>i</sub> <= 100, C<sub>i</sub> <= 5)

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Output one line for each test case, indicating the minimum cost. If it is impossible to transport all the K units of goods, output -1.
